Technique: HEWN; PAINTED; ENGRAVED; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB; SCULPTURED
Name: Shabti of Nebmehyt
Description: The Museum of Brussels possess three shabtis of the "Governor of the Oasis of the South, Nebmehyt". They all come from the excavations of Abydos carried out by E. Amelineau in 1895-1896. This limestone example is distinguished by a beautiful polychrome. The hieroglyphic text, written on six horizontal lines, is a version of Chapter 6 from the Book of the Dead.
